text: Ebiti Ndok-Jegede (born Ebiti Onoyom Ndok) is a Nigerian politician. She ran for presidency in the 2011 presidential election under the platform of the United National Party for Development, a party she once served as National Chairman. ==Life and career== Born in Ibadan, the capital city of Oyo State, South-Western Nigeria, Ndok-Jegede is a native of Akwa Ibom State, Nigeria. She started her career as a practicing nurse at the University College Hospital, Ibadan before she proceeded to the United Kingdom, where she obtained a degree in Management, Law, and Diplomatic Studies and also did Social Welfare training. In 2011, she was the only woman who ran for president of Nigeria under the platform of the United National Party for Development, receiving 98,262 votes. ==Personal life== Ndok-Jegede is married with four children. ==References== Category:Living people Category:Nigerian women in politics Category:Nigerian nurses Category:People from Ibadan Category:People from Akwa Ibom State Category:University of Ibadan people Category:Candidates in the Nigerian general election, 2011 Category:21st-century Nigerian women politicians Category:Year of birth missing (living people)
title: Ebiti Ndok
